title: 4 Reasons Why Organizations Don’t Use Their Utility Data
lead: With so many sites, lights, bills, and processes to oversee, it’s hard for any manager to see the full picture. It’s no wonder the vast majority of businesses fail to track and measure their energy data.

title: UK battery storage pipeline surpasses 16GW
lead: Nearly 1.1GW of battery storage capacity is currently operational compared to 0.7GW in December 2019, according to RenewableUK

title: Total takes big step into Texan solar with 2.2GW acquisition
lead: French energy giant also added 600 MW of battery storage assets

title: EAC: ‘Green Homes Grant voucher target would take over ten years to meet’
lead: MPs admit that issuing vouchers is continuing at snail’s pace

title: Italy’s hardest-hit Covid-19 region to become ‘hydrogen valley’
lead: The area will become home of new hydrogen trains supported by new production facilities

title: Green light for ‘world’s first energy island’ in North Sea
lead: The plant is forecast to cover the energy consumption of ten million households

title: Energy positive house slashes bills by £1,000 a year
lead: The house designed by Cardiff University is net negative in carbon emissions

title: New partnership to help boost energy efficiency in Ukraine’s housing sector
lead: Loans will be provided to homeowners’ associations that are participating in the Energy Efficiency Fund programme

title: United Utilities to sell stake in Estonian water company for £87.6m
lead: It is United Utilities’ last remaining non-regulated international business activity and is being sold to a consortium led by its existing partner, the City of Tallinn

title: New York offers $15m to pilot heat pump technology
lead: The heating and cooling of buildings is responsible for around 33% of all greenhouse gas emissions in New York State
